title: Top Reasons I Quit My Six-Figure Job to Become a Full-Time Content Creator
subtitle: Discover the motivations behind my decision to leave a lucrative job and embrace a new life as a content creator and dog dad.
content:
Why I Quit My Six-Figure Job

Here are the top five reasons why I just quit my six-figure job to become a full-time content creator and stay-at-home dog dad. I'm calling it my retirement.

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager, and now I'm unemployed.

Reason Number Four: No More Complaining

I was done complaining to others, well, mostly myself, that I wasn't getting paid what I was worth. But here's the problem with that statement:

You are forever and always the only person who actually knows what you're worth.

If you really want that six-figure salary, let me let you in on a quick calculation:

Fifty weeks a year, eight hours a day, five days a week, you just need to come up with a good or service to sell that's worth $400 on the open market. I know you have that within you.

If any of this is helpful, like and follow, and I'll keep trying to get you one step closer to where you need to be.
